intro: Montanoa gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's montanoa, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in high-altitude regions. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
